content.description:
Sleepyhead is a short but fun trad route. It is a good warm-up for "

I'm Too Tired

". This can be done as a boulder problem, but the landing is sketchy.
content.location:
Follow the approach route for The Great Roof. This is located below the route "

I'm Too Tired

".

content.description:
This is probably one of the most scenic boulder problems at USAFA, but I would steer clear. It’s a highball, and the entire top block shifted while I was climbing. It’s bound to come down at some point and could crush a car.

Otherwise, the climbing is fun, and the views are great.
content.location:
Follow the ridgeline of Mt. Ansel to

I'm Too Tired

, then continue up to the right. It is located at GPS coordinates 39.00573, -104.91147.

content.description: This obvious crack dissects two large granite blocks on a freestanding appearing face on the right side of the Eagle's Peak trail. The crack is large and almost an offwidth, requiring arm bars and a few good hand jams higher up. The crux is establishing yourself in the crack.
content.protection: It requires a range of gear to protect. The upper of the two small pinnacles at the top can be slung for a toprope.
content.location:
Head up the trail about 30 minutes and turn right and up at a fallen tree across the trail that has been chainsawed. About 1/2 mile directly north of Exemplar Tower.

The route is located at approximately GPS coordinates 39.00548, -104.91188.
